Definition 1: An extremely confused, complicated, or embarrassing situation.
Example 1: “What started as a simple misunderstanding about carpool duty turned into a full-blown family imbroglio by the weekend.”

Definition 1: Behave in a frivolous way.
Example 1: “He knew he should start packing, but it felt better to frivol on the porch with a cup of tea.”

Definition 1: A suite, typically for a solo instrument or chamber ensemble.
Example 1: “The quartet opened the concert with a lively partita that set the tone for the evening.”

Definition 1: One that excites contentions and quarrels.
Example 1: “We knew better than to invite the neighborhood makebate to the party.”

Definition 1: Pompous or extravagant in language, style, or manner, especially in a way that is intended to impress.
Example 1: “The speech, while intended to be motivational, came across as grandiloquent with too many pretentious words and phrases.”

Definition 1: A connoisseur of wines.
Example 1: “His extensive knowledge of vineyards and varietals confirmed he was a true oenophile.”

Definition 1: The simultaneous occurrence of events which appear significantly related but have no discernible causal connection.
Example 1: “It was a true matter of synchronicity when I happened to run into Samantha just as I’d been thinking about her.”

Definition 1: Not operating on a refined or elevated level; mundane.
Example 1: “My sister left her banausic desk job to pursue photography, hoping for a more creative life.”

Definition 1: Coarse linen or other cloth stiffened with gum or paste, and used as interfacing and in bookbinding.
Example 1: “The tailor added buckram to the collar so it would hold its shape through countless wears.”

Definition 1: An old or experienced sailor, especially one who has crossed the equator.
Example 1: “After decades at sea, he proudly earned the nickname of shellback from the ship’s crew.”

Definition 1: (Of a gem, especially when cut en cabochon) Showing a band of bright reflected light caused by aligned inclusions in the stone.
Example 1: “The jeweler held the chatoyant stone under the lamp, and a band of light rippled across its surface.”

Definition 1: An unfilled space or interval; a gap.
Example 1: “The report had a noticeable lacuna where the data for last quarter should’ve been.”

Definition 1: The scientific study of fungi.
Example 1: “My sister traces her interest in mycology back to her early reading of the mushroom hunt in ‘Anna Karenina.'”

Definition 1: (Of a product) Made or used as a substitute, typically an inferior one, for something else.
Example 1: “This ersatz meat tastes surprisingly similar to beef, but my vegetarian sister loves it.”

Definition 1: The quality of being characterized by vigorous activity and progress.
Example 1: “The mural captures the neighborhood’s dynamism through bold colors and sweeping lines.”

Definition 1: A foolish or ill-timed remark or action.
Example 1: “The chef shrugged at the bêtise of burning the first batch and simply started again.”

Definition 1: Establish a working relationship, typically in order to cooperate on a matter of mutual concern.
Example 1: “I’ll liaise with the event staff to make sure the venue is set up before guests arrive.”

Definition 1: Light and slightly contemptuous mockery or banter.
Example 1: “At the office holiday party, the persiflage at our table kept everyone laughing through the long speeches.”

Definition 1: A system of weights based on a pound of 16 ounces or 7,000 grains, widely used in English-speaking countries.
Example 1: “The cookbook listed measurements in avoirdupois weights, but I need to convert them to my measuring cups.”

Definition 1: An ephemeral plant.
Example 1: “The beautiful pink glow at sunset was ephemeral, dissolving before we could take a photo.”

Definition 1: A person who expresses opinions on matters outside the scope of their knowledge or expertise.
Example 1: “I try not to sit next to my ultracrepidarian aunt at family dinners, because she thinks she knows more about my job than I do.”

Definition 1: Attractive or appealing in appearance or character.
Example 1: “The actor’s winsome grin became his trademark on and off the screen.”

Definition 1: Passing under or through mountains.
Example 1: “We set up camp in a submontane meadow where the mountains loomed just beyond the treeline.”

Definition 1: The carrying of a boat or its cargo between two navigable waters.
Example 1: “We rented canoes for the weekend, but none of us realized the portage between lakes was nearly a mile uphill.”

Definition 1: A dirigible airship, especially one with a rigid structure.
Example 1: “The environmental group proposed using solar-powered dirigibles to monitor remote wildlife areas without disturbing the animals.”

Definition 1: (Of countryside) Green with grass or other rich vegetation.
Example 1: “After weeks of rain, the once-barren hills transformed into a verdant landscape.”

Definition 1: Polite, refined, or respectable, often in an affected or ostentatious way.
Example 1: “His genteel tone masked a sharp wit that few noticed until it was too late.”

Definition 1: The simultaneous occurrence of events which appear significantly related but have no discernible causal connection.
Example 1: “It was a true matter of synchronicity when I happened to run into Samantha just as I’d been thinking about her.”

Definition 1: A person who enjoys a sociable and luxurious lifestyle.
Example 1: “Make sure to include Sally and Trina on the guest list — they’re such bon vivants.”

Definition 1: A store of valuable or delightful things.
Example 1: “Her playlist was a trove of forgotten ’90s hits.”
